title.narrative: F.a: Reaching Out to Communities to Strengthen their Capacities to Prevent and Respond to Gender Based Violence and HIV

description.narrative: The project prevents domestic violence in Botswana, promotes understanding of the phenomenon and strengthens the referral system for victims of domestic violence. The project also improves the realization of the rights of the victims and increases local co mmunities’ skills and awareness over the different practices of identifying, supporting and protecting the victims of violence and their family members.The project is implemented by the Kagisano Society Women's Shelter Project KSWSP which is one of FELM ’s new partner organisations. In Botswana, violence against women and violence experienced by women are major factors limiting the rights of women in society. The government statistics show that up to two-thirds of women suffer violence at some point in their lives. The aim of KSWSP is to prevent violence against women, in particular, and to increase opportunities for women and men to handle situations of violence, to provide protection and therapy for victims of domestic violence, as well as to increase the awareness of gender based violence among different local stakeholders and the general public.KSWSP focuses on providing shelter and services to victims of domestic violence, seeks to influence public opinion in realizing the harmfulness of domestic vio lence, as well as lobbies state and local government authorities for ensuring services for victims of violence. In Botswana there are only two shelter houses, one in Maun and the KSWSP’s shelter house in Gaborone. The KSWSP also operates a low-threshold reception center, where one can get therapy and support, and have a discussion with the social worker about future options and services. Most part of the funding for the shelter and reception center comes from the state.
